annotation.TEXT: Now, here's where the level loops.
I want to be careful of my stray shots here. I wouldn't want to break important bricks up ahead.

So, here's how this level normally works: You have to enter the floating pipe up there to actually progress. Otherwise, this level will loop, kind of like when you take a wrong path in "maze" castles.
There's a vine leading to a sky bonus area here, which I'll get back to in a moment. First, I just want to show off what's to the right.
They're still perfectly flammable and inflammable, though!
There we go!
No, his abilities don't include being able to slice apart Podoboos.
However, due to what looks to be a very tricky jump below the pipe, I'm going to want to leave some bricks up here intact to use as stepping stones to go over the pipe again on my return trip.
His abilities should come in real handy here. (Too bad Interceptor's not here as well...)
Oh, my god. Did I seriously just do that?
Yep, but the game gave me the kind of lame Super Arm. Oh, well.
Now, for 5-4, I'm going to go with a random Ryu.
Okay, the hidden power up is above the right side of that upper ledge here. Maybe I should call Fire Man's version of Rush to help me out...

And fortunately, unlike in 3-1, I can actually backtrack to the flagpole after ending up at the warp zone from the bonus area. (Also, if you don't enter the sky bonus area, you can reach this warp zone by jumping over the flagpole.)
Here's his special properties...
Alright, here we go!
Now, I'm going to take the wrong path again, because I really want that hidden power up now. However, without the awesome weapons I had last time, this is gonna be trickier...
There's another evil dark mushroom, which I guess I can safely grab now. And, in the ceiling up there, a 1-up can be revealed.
If it is possible to get up there from the left side with Ryu, it probably requires perfect timing with my jump from the falling platform.
Oh, that's right. In Crossover, kicked shells can break bricks. This isn't the case in the original SMB games. Now, there's a power up block hidden within this chunk of bricks here...
There's a multi-coin block here.
I got FF6's Shadow. Cool.
There's a multi-coin block here, which is emptied in a split-second.
Huh, there's no wind. I'm guessing that Crossover just simply doesn't support wind, which is fine, because I'm not a big fan (heh) of it in The Lost Levels anyway.
Whoa, I'm lucky that fireball went high there.
That was a risky jump.
In order to actually progress with the level, I have to enter the floating pipe over here.
Demo count: 6
There's a hidden coin and 1-up right here.
Alright, there's the world 7 warp. Now to return to the normal exit while utterly destroying most of these bricks!
To be continued... Yo!
Oh, man. More upside-down Piranha Plants. Also, the bricks that are holding up the pipes contain coins in Crossover.
Watch out for this evil dark mushroom. It's evil.
Yeah, yeah. I'm low on time, but I think I'm getting close to the goal.

In this bonus room, there's a power up and a multi-coin block in a couple of the ceiling blocks. Oh, and I think someone mentioned to me earlier that this SMAS bonus room background will always show Mario in Crossover, even if you're using Luigi.
Whoa, there must've been some random computer processing going on in the background there.

Oh, over here is a place where I can potentially put together a 1-up combo by kicking a shell. And, it's got multiple Piranha Plants along the path, which can be thwacked by shells in Crossover... This could be good!
Yeah, screw those coins. I could probably get them with my springboard, but I just don't care right now.
Whoa, what the? I have no idea how I made a couple of those stomps without getting hurt. Also, apparently, a Bullet Bill can slowly push a koopa shell in Crossover, which is interesting.
Wow, I'm surprised that I managed to dodge that bullet. However, it made me have to use the springboard again.
Well, let's try this again, with a different random ninja.
Heck, yeah! And, whoa, again! I keep somehow stomping things while ascending like that! And wow, I just barely avoided falling in that pit! So many close calls there!
Oh, come on! How did I manage to screw up that way?
Awesome! I was able to make it through the lower path, and now I can grab the coins from this side.
Alright, let's try this again, shall we?
Okay, let's not totally miss my springboard here this time!
Nice! And I can take out two rows at once if I line it up properly!
The music changed because time's running out.
Demo count: 7
Fortunately, there's an extra block on the right side of the pipe that I guess is there to help weaker jumpers, so I don't need to use my springboard to get up there.
Alt. Skin votes include "almond rink skin" (no idea what that means), RD-008 (Bill), and Fire Man (Mega Man). Also, RD-008 was requested for world 5-2, and Ryu was requested for 5-4.
I'll be taking this mushroom, if you don't mind. (And even if you do mind.)
Ha! I'm not letting that 1-up get away!
Oh, yeah. I can't forget that I've got my AWESOME METAL BLADE, which looks like a big fireball when Fire Man uses it!
D'oh! The shell despawned off the left side of the screen (I was hoping to have it rebound off the pipe to my left). Well, maybe I can still get a 1-up combo with the next shell...
The upper-right block in this chunk contains a vine leading to the world 8 warp zone, but I'm not going to show that now.
Ooh, nice. I'll take that weapon energy, thank you very much.
ARGH!!! Well, there goes my charge shot and Super Arm... However, I think Fire Man's "double knockback" saved my life there, because it looked like I would've fallen in the pit otherwise.
Alright, so I'll use those characters in 5-2 and 5-4. For 5-1, I've decided to go with a random Luigi, and I got the SNES SMB2 Luigi.
(If it turned out that I couldn't backtrack to the flagpole from the warp zone here, I would've just let time run out and returned to midpoint.)
I can hit this block from the side, enabling me to more easily grab the power up, which gives me a bigger sword in this case.
Maybe the platforms were done this way to help weaker jumpers, or because Crossover would have a problem with the way this level normally works otherwise.
Alright, time to start tearing down this wall!
Oh, man. So many bricks. Well, I've got this charge shot here, so...
Party time!
Alright, so who should I use for world 6? Place your votes now! (Notes: World 6-2 is a water level, I think 6-3 has flying cheepos, and 6-4 is a "maze" castle where I have to take the right paths.)
Good thing I can hang out up here!
Also, there's the Pharaoh Shot too, which is awesome as well. Now, I'm going to intentionally take the "wrong" path once here, just to show the loop, and to pick up a hidden power up that's this way.
The bonus room sends me just a couple screens to the right, and all I skip are one additional pipe and a few enemies. Nothing special.
Monster combo! (10 hits) 3-life combo!
I think I got the Ninja Gaiden Trilogy Ryu this time.
Huh, that's weird. Shouldn't this be like one of those platforms that you see in sky bonus areas, which start off stationary and then continuously move to the right once you step on them?
Oh, geez. I'm kind of low on time here...
Huh, what's this? I can backtrack from here? Does that mean I can double-dip on the power up?
Timed that one perfectly.

Whoa, what the heck? ...Okay, I think I know what caused this anomaly in the video. The computer had just started doing its daily Avira update there. I usually try to avoid being in the middle of recording something when it happens, but fortunately, this didn't happen during anything important here.
Uh, oh. Random bullets, and I don't have a weapon that can destroy them.
Well, so much for my awesome Metal Blade and Pharaoh Shot...
Hello, and welcome back to more SMB Crossover! The voting results are shown up above as usual.
I will, however, use my springboard to help me make this jump.
And, after this Great-Wall-of-China-wannabe, there's a pipe followed by the flagpole.
Nailed it! Awesome!
Alright, it's time for Probotector's RD-008 to play 5-2! Let's see if I can manage to get my AWESOME SPREAD GUN back...
Shut up, clock. Also, I felt that I was gonna be too late on that first attempt there.

Ah, here I believe is the first time we see upside-down Piranha Plants in The Lost Levels. Unlike the normal ones, these guys don't care how close you are to the pipe and will always pop out, so don't linger under an upside-down pipe that has a Piranha Plant in it.
Uh, oh. I really wanted to get onto that upper ledge with the coins... This is gonna be tricky...
I hope I'll have enough time... Of course, it doesn't help that the timer invisibly counts down about 8 seconds during the automated vine-climbing as I enter this area...

I don't think there were any multi-coin blocks in those bricks this time. (BTW, Avira doesn't pop-up ads on me anymore, like the one that ruined a Magical Drop V run of mine last year, which is nice.)
However, I want to go back to the vine now. There's a reason I waited until after I showed the flagpole first.
And, with this AWESOME SPREAD GUN, I'm gonna tear through this place! Now, there's another power up block over here, followed almost immediately by a multi-coin block...
Okay, let's not get knocked into the pit by this stupid fire bar this time...
There's a super-embiggened fire bar up ahead.

I'd put more effort into trying for a perfect, but I'm really low on time here. Fortunately, Luigi can actually reach every single coin here without the moving platform, so I can still get most of them.
3-1 votes: 1
Reveal a couple of hidden coin blocks here to get over this wall.
Fortunately, it wasn't all that difficult to get past.
Alright, it's boss time, against Ganon!
What the? Again I somehow make a stomp that way! Well, I'm not complaining!
YESSS!!! IT'S THE "S"!!!
Not taking any chances, even though it looked like I could've easily made that jump without the springboard.
But, as I just said, I want to leave enough bricks intact so that I can just jump over the exit pipe instead of having to make a tricky jump below it.
Me want coins.
Okay, after you land, just to your right will be a warp zone to world 6. Of course, I'm not gonna take it, but I did want to at least show it.
Alright, now for 5-3, I could honestly go with either Fire Man or Samus. Hmm... I'll pick Fire Man.
There's an evil dark mushroom here, followed by a star not long afterwards!
Got him! Umm... I have no idea what he turned into, though.
